body:
I was looking some Riot Support's articles and in one of them there was this video and there was also this song that I would really listen. The song starts at 1:08, I tried shazam, but nothing. I also deleted the narrator voice and tried again shazam, but nothing... could you help me pls, I would really listen the original song.

Audio without narrator voice: https://vocaroo.com/i/s1Jug2IaY1Y5

replies.body:
https://www.universalproductionmusic.com/en-row/discover/albums/4248/Rhythm-Of-Life?wid=87261

I believe the track is "Evolving Dream".

Hope that helps!

(Speaking as a developer about as far from music/audio as one can get-)

This whole background world of music that's created, not to entice public/popular consumption, but to serve the endless needs of companies that need music to fit everything from advertising trailers to training videos is just... FASCINATING.

There's a certain variety and quantity over quality approach, combined with aesthetics targeting broad background appeal that I find weirdly sane and calming when you compare it to music that's engineered to grab audience attention.

In many cases, would a more expensive pop hit weirdly wind up stealing the show away from your message/product?
Are musicians in this field the "blue collar" solid session equivalents of a local handyman to the glitzy rock star that would be, say, a famous architect?
Pound for pound, dollar for dollar do these tracks make recording companies more money on the down low than the highly visible performant stuff?
